name: European Society for Evolutionary Biology
goal: The European Society for Evolutionary Biology is a learned society with over 1000 members. The objective of the society is to promote the study of organic evolution. The society seeks to achieve this object by, among other things: publishing the professional journal "The Journal of Evolutionary Biology"; organizing congresses and scientific meetings; rendering financial and other support to research into organic evolution; supporting activities to foster a scientifically based understanding of organic evolution in teaching and research; doing anything related to the above, directly or indirectly, or incidental thereto, all in the broadest sense.
interests: Climate Action, Education and training, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: The European Society for Evolutionary Biology has a strong interest in Horizon 2020.
